thread.title: Salman Khan Credits 'Real-life' Hardships for his 'Reel' Success
thread.title_full: Salman Khan Credits 'Real-life' Hardships for his 'Reel' Success

title: Salman Khan Credits 'Real-life' Hardships for his 'Reel' Success
text:
Photos In this File Photo, Bollywood actor Salman Khan while hosting the final of the reality show 'Bigg Boss 7’ in Mumbai. |AFP 
NEW DELHI: ‘Dabangg’ superstar Salman Khan feels that his ‘real life’ troubles have got the best out of him in his ‘reel life’. However, he does not want any of his problems to come in between his movie releases. 
During the trailer launch of his upcoming flick ‘Prem Ratan Dhan Payo’ in Mumbai, the actor, who is all set to woo his audiences with his ‘Prem’ avatar, said, “I have been through difficult times all my life but that has brought the best out of me in my work. However, we have done a lot of hard work on this movie and I would not want my difficult times to bring about any hassles in its release.” 
The 49-year-old actor, who will be hosting controversial reality show ‘Bigg Boss Season-9’, will be seen romancing Sonam Kapoor in his upcoming flick for the first time, ‘Prem Ratan Dhan Payo’. 
Directed by Sooraj Barjatya, the movie is a family drama which also stars Anupam Kher and Neil Nitin Mukesh in pivotal roles. 
The movie is scheduled to release on November 12.
